article_title: Australia Finds Way to Deal With Divisive Asylum-Seeker Issue: Outsource It
article_text:
WELLINGTON, New Zealand—Asylum seekers, a divisive political issue in Australia, are giving an unlikely shot in the arm to impoverished South Pacific economies that otherwise risk being left behind.

In the past two months, Nauru and Papua New Guinea have signed deals to receive increased aid in exchange for resettling refugees trying to reach Australia—taking advantage of the harder line adopted by Australian political parties ahead...

twitter.description: Impoverished Nauru and Papua New Guinea benefit financially from Australia's harder line on refugees, collecting increased aid in exchange for resettling them.
twitter.creator: @lucy_craymer

image.alt: Asylum seekers give an unlikely shot in the arm to impoverished South Pacific economies

twitter.title: Australia's Approach to Asylum-Seeker Issue: Outsource It
